intro: I’m a UI/UX designer creating not just beautiful but effective designs that solve business problems, boost conversions, and scale easily. I work at the intersection of design, product, and frontend: I understand how products think and how frontend code works, while considering metrics, MVPs, and development constraints. I think like a user, calculate like a product manager, and structure like an engineer—turning business goals into clear, logical, and feasible interfaces.
about-efficiency-text: Design that solves problems, not just looks good. User experience is optimized for conversion growth. Focus on speed: MVP, launch, tests—all to quickly understand what works.
about-system-text: Creating design systems that are easy to scale and maintain. I consider technical constraints, understand frontend, and work in a way that makes life easier for developers.
about-strategy-text: I see the product as a whole: from idea and structure to final implementation. I contribute at all stages to ensure the result is deliberate and impactful, not random.
stack-paragraph:
In my work, I combine analytics, interface thinking, and visual expression.

A project starts with research: I study competitors, conduct interviews, and clarify what matters to users. Based on this, I build user flows and create the framework for the future interface.

The visual part is implemented through adaptive mockups and interactive prototypes in Figma. At this stage, I actively test hypotheses—sometimes even roughly, but with a clear goal: to understand where the interface works and where it doesn’t.

If needed, I add animations in After Effects, create promo videos, or do basic frontend with Tailwind/CSS to build an MVP. I work with Git and can streamline processes for teams or freelance projects.
projects-paragraph: Each of these projects is more than just a set of screens. They are thoughtful solutions based on user needs, clear logic, and visual expressiveness. I’ve gone through the entire process: from initial sketches and mistakes to the final pixel-perfect interface. Each project reflects my approach, style, and responsibility for the result.
projects-downloadPage-paragraph: The goal was to increase conversion and update an outdated page. I started from scratch: conducted brief interviews with marketing, identified user needs, gathered UX tasks, and created a mockup. After corridor tests and revisions, I built the final version using Bootstrap 4.
projects-downloadPage-result: A concise interface focused on action and clean visual presentation. The page became clearer and more effective for users.
projects-downloadPage-stats-5: 3 positive reviews from the sales team
projects-downloadPage-stats-6: A/B test: new version outperformed the old in 7 out of 8 metrics
projects-registry-paragraph: A section on the Varwin Education website where 3D, VR, and XR projects on various topics—from educational to entertainment—are collected. Previously, users had no place to share their projects; now they can submit them for publication, and others can download them directly. This simplified content access and reduced the workload on the sales team. In the future, self-uploading will be added.
projects-registry-result: The section simplified access to user projects, reduced manual work, and became the first step toward building a developer community within Varwin.
projects-registry-stats-5: 3 positive reviews from the sales team
projects-registry-stats-6: A/B test: new version outperformed the old in 7 out of 8 metrics
design-xrms-text: The main section with components and prototypes for visualizing innovations in the Varwin XRMS platform
design-subscout-text: A mobile app for adding and tracking user subscriptions to paid services
design-baikal-text: Redesign of the landing page for the ‘Time to Hike’ travel club, offering trips to Baikal
design-pioner-text: Redesign of the landing page for a power machinery factory
